member.name: T:WebApi.DocumentationController.Functions.ObjectGenerator
member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data. NOTE: Copied from the ASP.NET Web Stack 17. November 2012

member.name: M:WebApi.DocumentationController.Functions.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: M:WebApi.DocumentationController.Functions.SampleGeneratorService.#ctor
member.summary: Prevents a default instance of the class from being created.

member.name: M:WebApi.DocumentationController.Functions.SampleGeneratorService.GetSampleObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the sample object that will be serialized by the formatters. First, it will look at the . If no sample object is found, it will try to create one using .

member.name: M:WebApi.DocumentationController.Functions.SampleGeneratorService.TryFormatJson(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to format the string as indented json.

member.name: M:WebApi.DocumentationController.Functions.SampleGeneratorService.TryFormatXml(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to format the string as indented XML.

member.name: P:WebApi.DocumentationController.Functions.SampleGeneratorService.SampleObjects
member.summary: Gets the objects that are serialized as samples by the supported formatters.
